intro: Hiraea smilacina, commonly known as the creeping smilacina, is a climbing plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Smilacaceae and is characterized by its slender, twining stems that allow it to climb other vegetation. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are typically clustered in umbels. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a waxy texture. Hiraea smilacina is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky areas.
